cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles SE of Great Abaco Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the northwestern Bahamas, then expected to run along or just inland of Florida’s east coast before curving north-northwest over southeastern Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the east-central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral–Daytona Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect (yellow watch area absent on cone)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the northwestern Bahamas (Abacos, Berry Islands, Bimini, Eleuthera, Grand Bahama Island, New Providence)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East coast of Florida north of West Palm Beach, Georgia and South Carolina coasts lie within the Day-3 to Day-4 cone
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds with a peak 18 % probability; strongest winds most likely late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None indicated for Georgia coast in current advisory
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–3 inches possible as system passes inland Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Heavy rain bands may reduce visibility and create short-term berthing challenges
